definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: The bull artist, on the other hand, cares nothing for truth or falsehood.
sentences.chinese: 扯淡艺术家，另一方面，丝毫不关心真实或谎言。

sentences.english: A symposium on Camus is a lie.
sentences.chinese: 一场关于加缪的讨论会本身就是扯淡。

sentences.english: The essay on [bull] arose from that kind of struggle.
sentences.chinese: 这份关于扯淡的论文就源于那种斗争。

sentences.english: "It was a bit of horseplay that went seriously wrong, " said a Chelsea source.
sentences.chinese: “这事太扯淡了，”切尔西的消息人士说。

sentences.english: How could you even think that I could believe that hare-brained fairy tale?
sentences.chinese: 你居然认为我会相信这么没脑子的扯淡？

sentences.english: For me it's not even an issue.
sentences.chinese: 不过这些扯淡的事都入不了我的眼。

sentences.english: One of the most salient features of our culture is that there is so much [bull].
sentences.chinese: 我们的文化最显著的特色之一就是有太多的扯淡。

sentences.english: No small three existence, who go to identify your distraction love.
sentences.chinese: 没有小三的存在，谁去鉴定你们那些扯淡的爱情。

sentences.english: " he asked, while bull "is sort of cuddly and warm?
sentences.chinese: 他问道，而扯淡“竟有点可爱和暖人？

sentences.english: No, he did not believe it.
sentences.chinese: 不，他根本就不信这些扯淡。

definition: to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
